results.title: Senior Interaction Designer (UX)
results.description:
Company Description

At Spear, our mission is to help dentists and their teams pursue and achieve “Great Dentistry.” Spear drives dental practice growth by advancing our clients clinical skills, improving their practice management capabilities and enhancing the patient experience by leveraging both our deep dental expertise and our technology forward solutions. We offer holistic solutions that include a full learning management system, a practice consulting service supported by a robust analytics platform and industry experts, and patient engagement tools that complement the normal workflows within a dental practice. In addition, we deliver live, collaborative education led by the brightest clinical and business minds in dentistry through virtual seminars and events, as well as through hands on learning opportunities at our state-of-the-art campus in scenic North Scottsdale. 



Job Description

As the Senior Interaction Designer, you will partner with product owners to design and improve the user experience across the Spear product ecosystem. The Interaction Designer strategically drives customer behaviors, while refining designs and constantly striving for improvement in the customer journey. This role will create visual solutions to boost engagement, supporting key business objectives and the digital framework of Spear. You are a collaborative, prototyping expert with a passion for innovation and the customer experience!  

Job Duties:  

  • Leverage design tools like Figma and Adobe XD to rapidly prototype solutions and incorporate any user feedback into the final design. 
  • Design for various devices and platforms such as mobile, tablet, desktop, app and tv application keeping device limitations and standards in mind.  
  • Refine the prototypes throughout the product lifecycle (strategy, design discovery, testing and product delivery).  
  • Support the development team when designing for specific features or libraries used on a project.  
  • Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, personas, wireframes, user flows and sitemaps.  
  • Create and optimize graphics and images to hand off for the development team.  
  • Provide ongoing support for supporting features and functions requested to Spear digital products.  
  • Present solutions to optimized workflows, eliminate customer pain points and increase engagement.  
  • Leverage design patterns and contribute to our product design system for rapid prototyping and expedited development and global consistency.  
  • Design sustainable component-based UI elements, like menus, tabs and widgets to be added to the design system and used throughout all the Spear products.  
  • Continue to bridge the gap between products creating a consistent look and experience for our customers.  
  • Help develop and embellish our Spear Design System and Figma component library. 
  • Attend or conduct ongoing user research, focus groups, interviews, etc. using user testing tools to test, validate and iterate on product designs and feature enhancements. 
  • Gain an understanding of our consumers behavior and pain points to use as the driving factors during the design process.  
  • Analyze customer data and analytics to provide suggested approaches to help eliminate friction and increase user engagement.  
  • Identify design trends and market conditions that might present opportunities for Spear.  



Qualifications
  • 5+ years of experience as an UI-UX Designer or similar role
  • Previous experience in a SaaS organization strongly preferred
  • Knowledge of Figma and Adobe products including Photoshop, Illustrator, Acrobat and XD, or other design and prototyping software   
  • Bachelor’s degree in relevant field preferred  

Candidates under consideration will be required to submit a professional UI design portfolio for review.   



Additional Information

What Spear Offers

As the leader in our industry, we rely on the creativity and expertise of our people to deliver the best for our clients. In return, we invest in our employees by offering a diverse suite of benefits. We believe in offering choice and flexibility to keep our employees and their families healthy and happy today forward.

  • Great Work/Life Balance - Unlimited time off program along with paid time off for volunteering. We also have shorter meetings times and Core Hours to help support a healthy work life balance for employees in all time zones!
  • Comprehensive Health & Wellness Benefits - Medical (including your pets!), Dental, & Vision benefits and a 401k with a generous match. We also offer Maternity & Paternity Leave. Additional benefits include Mental Health Day, and the Maven Maternity & Health Joy apps.
  • Company Sponsored Events - Think costume contests, annual Wellness Day, May the 4th be with you, Friday afternoon "Get Giphy With It", team builders, and 5k’s!
  • Career Development Pathways - Career development through continuous coaching, training, and on the job learning along with a quarterly review process.
  • Remote and Hybrid Work Options - You can work remote, onsite, or anywhere in between! We know great talent lives all over! If you don't live in Arizona and are interested in working at Spear, we will consider each state on a case-by-case basis due to the implications of doing business in each state.
  • STRIVE Program - Our peer recognition program that helps us celebrate one another's efforts and accomplishments. We like to recognize and reward the most amazing coworkers around!
  • DE&I - We care about each other and have our Spear Collective groups to support this to ensure everyone feels a strong sense of belonging.
  • Transparent Communication - We believe in a collaborative and trustworthy workplace with bi-weekly Company Wide All Hands Meetings and weekly 1:1's. We also send out weekly Office Vibe surveys to all employees for insights and feedback - we listen so we can make positive changes!

Spear Education deeply values diversity and what it brings to our communities and our organization. 

Everyone is welcomed here, regardless of how you look, your physical abilities, where you come from, when you were born, what you believe in, how you identify, who you love, how you think, and whether or not you have served.

We seek to create a culture where each person feels heard, supported and engaged in a positive, empathetic way. 

We are allies in, and advocates for, our shared humanity.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

results.title: Graphic Designer
results.description:
Beckett Collectibles is a leader in the trading card and collectibles industry providing pricing, grading, ecommerce, and other products and services for the sport, non-sport, and gaming collector. With a focus on integrity, commitment, and accuracy, Beckett will continue to be a leader in the collectibles industry providing dynamic products and services to collectors worldwide. Find out more about Beckett products and services at www.beckett.com.


Throughout the interview process we will ask you to provide samples of engaging marketing materials such as web page content, e-books, blog posts, case studies, videos, infographics, or emails that you created.


The ideal senior designer is a hands-on creative with an excellent sense of typography and photo direction, attention to detail, strong conceptual skills, and an expert understanding of paid marketing channels.

Responsibilities

  • Under the guidance of the head of marketing, develop and execute creative messaging for digital and social content across multiple platforms (especially Instagram and TikTok).
  • Efficiently work within tight deadlines to manage projects and create accurate, concise, and well-polished creative assets (stills and video) that deliver on the goals from the marketing team.
  • Repurpose existing photo and video assets to create channel-specific, innovative assets for marketing across paid social, email and events.
  • Work within processes and the project management tools to streamline approvals and cross-functional alignment.
  • Monitor performance and feedback of paid creative assets to refine and iterate upon the creative strategy for paid ads.
  • Assist with concept and art direction of photoshoots, working closely with photographers and stylists and in house digital content producer.

Requirements

  • A degree or equivalent experience in Graphic Design, digital design, or any related fields.
  • 4-5 years of professional experience executing creative assets from scratch (Instagram, Facebook, TikTok), as well as display, email and video paid ads.
  • Critical thinker, great communicator with can-do attitude: the ideal candidate will brainstorm and develop creative concepts for photo and video shoots, and the post-production phase
  • Effective communication and presentation skills to interact with the internal Beckett team and outside partners
  • Impeccable attention to detail and quality assurance
  • Strong prioritization, time management, and organizational skills
  • Strong understanding of the target audience, industry trends, and platform nuances
  • Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite, social media platforms, MS Office, basic understanding of HTML, Microsoft Word, and Excel
  • Understanding of paid metrics; able to interpret the results and take action to increase effectiveness of creative
  • Comfortable with production-related work (editing photos, resizing to fit on social platforms, creating templates to work with, etc.)
  • This role will be 20% concepting / 80% design and execution

results.title: Product and Design Lead
results.description:
About Burq

Burq started with an ambitious mission: how can we turn the complex process of offering delivery into a simple turnkey solution.

We started with building the largest network of delivery networks, partnering with some of the biggest delivery companies. We then made it extremely easy for businesses to plug into our network and start offering delivery to their customers. Now, we’re powering deliveries for some of the fastest-growing companies from retailers to startups.

It’s a big mission and now we want you to join us to make it even bigger! 🚀

We’re already backed by some of the Valley's leading venture capitalists, including Village Global, the fund whose investors include Bill Gates, Jeff Bezos, Mark Zuckerberg, Reid Hoffman, and Sara Blakely. We have assembled a world-class team all over the U.S.

We operate at scale, but we're still a small team relative to the opportunity. We have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to grow while doing the most important work of your career.

We want people who are unafraid to be wrong and support decisions with numbers and narrative. Here’s a quick overview of what you will be doing:


Product Manager

As the Product Lead at Burq, you will work closely with co-founders, technical, and functional teams to manage the process of transforming feedback and ideas into concrete features and product enhancements in our existing platform. You will help to strategically continue building our product roadmap, identify gaps, utilize customer feedback, scope out features, and own the UI/UX design of our platform. You will be part of an emerging team that is helping our clients optimize their delivery operations, and have an immediate impact as the first employee dedicated to this function at a fast-growing, early-stage startup.

What You'll Do

    • Be one of the first 20 people in a growing company on an amazing team
    • Work closely with leadership and engineering to build out the product roadmap, set goals, and execute on project plans
    • Manage the delivery of new features from end to end, start from defining the problem through shipping and measuring success
    • Align with leadership and marketing functions to ensure new features are shared with and adopted by existing customers
    • Define visual UI for mobile and web. Focusing on UI, product branding, and content presentation.
    • Lead the initiative on UX and visual design to help evolve the design of our applications.
    • Rapidly create multiple solutions with sketches, prototypes, and wireframes.
    • Communicate designs and specifications in a reproducible/scalable manner.
    • Spend time talking to customers and analyzing feedback to inform product decisions
    • Play a key role in providing our customers with the best experience possible!

Requirements

Who You Are

  • 3+ years of experience in a product management role (bonus for product-led SaaS company experience)
  • Background working across engineering, design, customer success, and sales
  • Past experience communicating with customers to gather data about pain-points, and communicating that data with key stakeholders to evaluate against the product roadmap
  • Passion for running experiments, and using data-driven approaches to measure and track success
  • Experience writing PRDs and working with engineering teams to scope and workload balance
  • Prior experience with owning UI/UX design
  • An online portfolio featuring your web application, mobile, and any other relevant work.
  • Expert eye to detail for outstanding creative and visual design.
  • Have a go-getter attitude and thrive in the startup environment - you are not shy to experiment with new concepts and use data to validate success
  • Experience using JIRA, agile project management methodologies, and product management software
  • Are highly organized and able to adapt to changing priorities
  • Are a skilled listener & with excellent verbal and written communications

Benefits

About the Team

Owners: We hire a smaller number of high-quality, talented individuals and trust their judgment.

Builders: We are a very early-stage startup, which means there is an endless amount of opportunity to build! We value transparency and cross-collaboration when trying out new strategies, testing new ideas, and giving/receiving feedback.

Velocity: We move fast and with intention. We believe in transparency across our team in order to maintain our velocity and ensure we are not losing focus on the company. mission and vision

Long-Term Thinking: As a small startup, there are endless opportunities that we can tackle in our industry. To ensure we effectively scale and continue to be a market leader, we keep our team focused on our critical initiatives, and provide every team member with full-autonomy over their work in order to meet our long-term goals.

Benefits: We believe in investing heavily in our employees, and provide the below benefits to our team members:

  • Competitive compensation packages, including salary and equity options
  • Remote-First work environment
  • Medical, Dental, Vision insurance
  • Learning and Development Stipend
  • Work-from-home Stipend
  • Generous PTO

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion: At Burq, we value diversity and take providing our diverse workforce with an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, martial status, veteran status, or disability status.

results.title: Senior Product Designer
results.description:
• Synthesize behavioral information and visualize things as they might be instead of how they are. Keep users at the center of everything.
  • Understand the wants, desires, struggles, and behaviors of users and advocate for them
  • Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs.
  • Advance a strong point of view backed up by personal expertise, design rationale, user research data, and industry trends
  • Conceptualize a broad spectrum of ideas and then narrow them based on experimentation and user research
  • Use business requirements, market research, and customer feedback to assist in developing scenarios, use cases, and high-level requirements.

  • Fun events for the family!

results.title: User Experience Researcher
results.description:
About Us

At Exo Digital, we solve digital problems – the challenging, weird, and sometimes invisible kinds of problems. Pushing boundaries to deliver innovative experiences in a fast-moving world is what we do best.

The Role

Our Consultants work closely with our client partners within our augmentation team, bringing their wide range of expertise and consulting acumen to the business. They like the variety of work consulting brings them, exposing them to a wide variety of business domains and industries. You don't just do – you teach. Your knowledge is bridging a gap in the business you are working for.

Being a consultant means that you will develop your commercial experience and confidence to consult with the client beyond the focus on delivery. It’s about being strategic and opportunistic in your approach.

Requirements

Who you are
  • A mixture of creative and technical skills
  • 5+ years experience working as a UX Researcher or similar role
  • Excellent team-working skills
  • Verbal communication skills, as you present your research findings and the reasons behind your design decisions
  • Creativity and innovation, to come up with new ideas
  • Enthusiasm for design and technology
  • The ability to use Figma, Miro, Figjam
  • Experience in IA research utilising user interviews, card sorting and tree jacking

 

What you’ll do
  • Review, plan, design and investigate the audiences for websites and assist in creating user journeys to inform the good experiences in services, content and design
  • Contribute or lead interviews and research activities to inform best practice
  • Support or lead conversations on IA, wire-framing and user experience
  • Meet clients to gather information about their requirements and to find out what needs researching, designing or usability testing
  • Understand qualitative and quantitative research methods
  • Put users at the centre of a design to make it simple, easy to use and good looking
  • Be confident in your presentation skills in order to present the stages of the design development to business users
  • Work closely within a multidisciplinary team, including, stakeholders, designers and programmers

Benefits

What we can offer
  • Flexible work arrangements - we really mean this! We’re outcome driven rather than clock watchers. We’re here to accommodate different working styles to ensure you are being your most productive self.
  • Home office set up budget
  • Treats on your birthday
  • Training budget
  • Remote working - we’re accepting applicants across Australia.
  • Coworking space available whenever you change of scenery - available in our Sydney, Melbourne and Brisbane co-working spaces
  • Monthly up-skilling and hackathon events - this year we’re up-skilling the team around Web3 technologies such as Blockchain, Cryptocurrency, AR/VR, NFTs and Metaverse
  • Monthly team bonding events - we’ll fly you from wherever you are in Australia to our office in Melbourne on a monthly basis to have fun in person!
  • Fun and vibrant culture - the best team! But we might be biased. We promise you won’t be disappointed.
  • Incentives for those who go above and beyond
  • Discretionary annual bonus

Bonuses

results.title: Workforce Experience (WX) Designer
results.description:
Company Description

About Us

Leapgen is a global digital transformation company shaping the Now of Work. We partner with enterprise leaders to better design and deliver workforce services and architect HR technology solutions that meet the expectations of workers and the needs of the business. Our areas of focus include HR Technology, HR Operations and Service Delivery, and Workforce Experience. Leapgen is founded on the core values of Love, Energy, Audacity and Proof. That means we

  • LOVE what we do, which
  • ENERGIZES us and our clients to do
  • AUDACIOUS things, and
  • PROVE our success - early and often!

We’re smart, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. We’re passionate about improving workforce experience and positioning HR to better serve people while acting as a strategic partner to the business. We think differently: transformation is constant, disruption should be healthy and strategic, and people and business are meant to be agile. As such, we encourage and expect our people to be innovative, to do different things. We challenge ourselves to stretch, adapt, learn and improve...constantly. Our customers will tell you we feel like a valued extension of their team because we are.



Job Description

What You’d Do

The Workforce Experience Designer helps design experiences (interactions + transactions) that meet workforce expectations. In this role, you should be an analytical and creative designer who is able to grasp client needs and collaborate with others to solve problems and continually improve. You will collaborate with Leapgen Consultants, our Clients and their software providers and implementation partners to help design frictionless experiences throughout the design thinking lifecycle - from getting to know and empathize with members of the workforce to iterating on ideas and recommending changes to processes and/or content to providing input on proofs-of-concepts and prototypes to be tested.   

The Day-to-Day Stuff

  • Participate with Leapgen Consultants in customer research (e.g., focus groups, interviews, surveys) to create personas and journey maps based on how our customers’ workforces experience work today 

  • Find creative ways to solve UX and knowledge management problems (e.g. usability, findability)

  • Make recommendations on how best to improve experiences (e.g., streamline processes, change the interaction model, modify information architecture) recommend how to evaluate success

  • Develop wireframes and prototypes around customer needs [to be enabled via any number of HR and workforce technologies]

  • Build out and refine tools & templates with guidance from the company's Services team members

  • Great communicator with fellow Leapers and customers alike. We operate on it!

  • We use both Google apps and Microsoft Office apps; you probably do, too

  • Proficiency developing process flows (e.g., LucidChart, Visio, Miro) preferred



Qualifications

This Should Describe You

  • Passion for solving customer problems (and proven ability to do so)

  • Interest/Experience in HR and digital workforce experience design

  • Minimum 2 years design experience, either customer-facing or internal to an organization

  • Strong portfolio of design projects is a really nice bonus

Education

  • Bachelor’s Degree ideal

  • Certificate in Design with a focus on UX is also awesome!



Additional Information

What Type of Job is This?

Contract or Permanent; we can explore the right arrangement for all

Location & Travel

  • Remote (continental US or Canada); we’re a virtual company! 

  • Up to 20% possible

How to get started: If you’re excited by the idea of seeing yourself in this role at Leapgen, please apply with your CV and a cover letter that best expresses your interest and unique qualifications. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Leapgen makes an oath to protect people in the workplace. We are committed to reducing conscious and unconscious bias and fostering a judgement-free workplace that celebrates diversity. Here are a few ways we put this into action:

  • We want you to shine through a great interview experience. When we reach out to schedule a conversation, we’ll ask whether you require any accommodation to make that so.

  • We don’t seek culture fit; rather, we seek and welcome diverse ideas and perspectives that can enhance our culture, showcase new perspectives, and challenge our thinking. You can be you here.

results.title: Lead Product Designer
results.description:
About Plato

Founded in 2017 by two engineers, Plato is the mentorship platform for engineering teams. With 1,500+ mentors, expert Talent Coaches, and exclusive resources, Plato has helped thousands of mentees, from companies around the world, improve their skills and become better leaders.

 

We're backed by a group of impressive advisors and investors including SaaStr, Y Combinator, the Slack Fund, S28 Capital, Mathilde Collin (Front), Andrew Miklas (PagerDuty), and many more!

 

Plato is seeking an experienced, passionate product designer to create a delightful end-user experience in our mentorship platform. As this will be our first full-time in-house design hire, our ideal candidate has a founder’s mindset, high tolerance for ambiguity and change, and a strong track record of designing and delivering great user experiences at high-growth product companies. 

 

Responsibilities

You’ll take direct responsibility for our end-to-end user experience for both mentees and mentors, working closely with partners in Product Management, Engineering, Mentorship Success. You’ll help drive the product lifecycle from problem definition and prioritization, to solution design and validation, to delivery and evaluation. You will be the voice of the end user in business and product decisions, having built a deep understanding of our users’ needs, thought patterns, and behaviors through empathy-driven research and concept testing. 

 

More responsibilities in detail:

  • Drive the definition of our end-to-end user experience by iterating on our journey maps and service blueprints.

  • Define the problems we need to solve, and design the solutions we will build to solve them, in partnership with Product Management and other teams.

  • Validate UX concepts and designs through evaluative user research to ensure that our solutions will address the problems we want to solve for our users.

  • Conduct generative research to develop a deep understanding of our users.

  • Create clear designs and requirements to enable high-velocity delivery for our engineering team, answering questions promptly and supporting the QA process.

  • Present designs, research, and insights to cross-functional teams and senior company leadership.

 

Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience as an in-house product/UX designer at high-growth companies and/or startups.

  • Strong sense of urgency. You push yourself and your teammates to ship, measure, and learn as quickly as possible. 

  • Proven experience in all phases of the design process including user research, copywriting, wire-framing, prototyping, visual design, interaction design, and usability testing. You may not be an expert in every area, but you are comfortable and proficient at wearing each of these hats when needed.

  • An intuitive eye for customer needs beyond the obvious, balanced with an instinct to question assumptions and biases, and bring user insights into every decision. 

  • Relationship-driven collaboration based on trust, candor, and generosity.

  • Ability to drive complex projects with multiple stakeholders and contributors.

  • Ability to collect, interpret, and apply both qualitative and quantitative insights.

  • A well-rounded portfolio of product design work, demonstrating a strong understanding of business objectives, user needs, and design techniques and best practices.

  • Ability to effectively communicate and persuade around design concepts

  • Passion for design; not satisfied with the status quo and always thinking of ways to improve

  • Demonstrated interest in mentorship, with experience as both a mentor and mentee (formal or informal).

 

Why Choose Plato

At Plato, you’ll be given the opportunity to contribute to something truly meaningful that positively impacts thousands of people around the world. Aligning with our mission, we believe that by investing in our team members’ personal and professional development, we can unlock Plato’s full potential and build a thriving work environment for the greater tech community. Even a 10% improvement here will lead to a ripple effect that will benefit our community. 

 

We spend nearly all of our waking lives at work, let’s make it better! Here are some of the ways we do that at Plato:

  • Work from anywhere: On our fully-remote team, you can work from anywhere in the world as long as you have 3-4 hours of PT overlap for non-customer facing roles and 5 hours PT overlap for customer-facing roles. 

  • Unlimited responsible time off: Take time away to do what you love and recharge with unlimited responsible time off. 

  • Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement: Grow within your role or try something new with opportunities for advancement within Plato.

  • Comprehensive benefits package: Medical, dental, and vision coverage to keep you happy and healthy. 

  • In-person team building activities: We bring our team members together for regular in-person events in awesome locations like the Metaverse, France, Mexico, New Orleans, California, and Spain to name a few! 

  • Work with amazing companies: Hundreds of top technology companies have chosen Plato to strengthen their teams including Box, Segment, Rakuten, and Betterment. 

  • A diverse team from around the world: Work and learn from a group of diverse team members from around the world including the United States, Canada, France, Spain, South Africa, Germany, Poland, Switzerland, India, Brazil, and more. 

 

Plato is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, nationality, disability, protected veteran status, gender identify, or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. 

Learn more about your equal employment opportunity (EEO) rights as an applicant here.

Plato is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please provide us with additional information on the nature of your request.

results.title: Senior/Mid 3D Environment Artist
results.description:
Metaverse Game Studios, Inc

St. Petersburg, Florida USA/ Remote

Metaverse is a young and independent game development company led by industry veterans who worked for core games such as Far Cry, Destiny, Halo series, Warface, League of Legends, Diablo Immortal, Mount&Blade series, Metro Exodus, and more. We are developing Angelic, which has an equal emphasis on storytelling and party-based RPG elements, all backed by a dark and compelling science-fiction setting in which you are often mesmerized by the complexity of the events happening around you.

If you are up to a challenge and want to deliver unforgettable RPG experiences to players around the world, our family is ready to welcome you!

PLEASE APPLY IF ONLY YOU ARE INTERESTED IN A FULL TIME POSITION - NO OUTSOURCE ARTISTS OR STUDIOS.

The Angelic Game

Angelic combines turn-based strategy combat with a narrative RPG, all backed by a collaboratively crafting science-fiction setting thanks to blockchain technology. Get ready to shape a massive conflict in the dark and compelling universe of Angelic.

It will not be an easy journey, and each action will have deep echoing repercussions. But don't worry, you won't have to do it alone.

PLEASE APPLY IF ONLY YOU ARE INTERESTED IN A FULL TIME POSITION - NO OUTSOURCE ARTISTS OR STUDIOS.

Job Description

As a Senior Environment Artist you will be responsible for creating high-quality believable Sci-Fi 3D environment assets for production.


Responsibilities:

  • Creation of high-quality, 3D environment assets and textures
  • Integration of 3D assets into Unreal Engine
  • Collaboration with the Art Director and Lead Environment Artist to maintain consistency on the art style
  • Ensure performance and technical quality of 3D environment assets
  • Optimization of assets to fit technical requirements
  • Identify and troubleshoot problems and provide solutions
  • Cooperation with other departments of the studio



Skills & Requirements

  • A minimum of 4 years' experience as an Environment / Props artist in game development
  • Great understanding of next-gen (PBR) asset creation workflows
  • A keen eye for composition, shape, color, and detail
  • Very good skills in Blender, Maya, 3DS Max, Zbrush, and Photoshop
  • Solid hard surface and organic modeling skills
  • Being able to create modular/reusable environment assets 
  • Strong texture creating/painting skills on softwares like Substance Designer/Painter
  • Being able to adapt realistic sci-fi art style
  • Ability to manage environments from creating layouts to the detailed and finished product
  • Unreal Engine blueprint (visual scripting) and material/shader knowledge
  • Unreal Engine lighting skills
  • Ability to manage your own time and work within deadlines
  • Great communication skills and being a team player
  • AA+ game experience
  • Fluent in English, both verbally and written

If you are interested in creating something new in game development space, this is your chance to be part of something huge! Apply now and get the inside scoop on our new and exciting game IP!

This new opportunity and experience we're offering could be the open door you've been looking for to a new universe for you.


Diversity and Inclusion

Diversity and inclusion are very important for us. The creative potential and hard work of all our team members is what matters to us. You can be anyone or even any-thing, and as long as you're helping us create this amazing product we all love, you're more than welcome in our team. Moreover, diversity brings out creativity and it's valued and cherished at Metaverse Game Studios.

results.title: Head of Product Design
results.description:
In 2019 we set out to offer individual and smaller institutional investors access to top-tier private equity funds through an easy-to-use digital platform that enables investors to tailor their portfolio. The global private equity space is quickly expanding with net asset value having grown seven-fold since 2002. That's almost double the growth in public equity markets. Investors have been backing entrepreneurs at record pace and last year, startups attracted $675 billion of Venture Capital (VC) funding globally, with Europe being the fastest-growing region.

We're now a fully remote team of 80+, with hires from UBS, Bain & Co, BCG Digital Ventures and more, and we've already opened up a pool of $50tn underserved capital - we're scaling this year to do even more, and looking for talented folk to join us on our journey.

 
The opportunity

We’re looking for an inspiring and talented Head of Product Design who is excited to help shape and build a best-in-class investment platform to shake up the status quo in private equity markets. We’re expanding fast, so we’re looking for people who are natural initiative-takers, who bring out the best in others, are brilliant listeners and can grow our business without compromising standards, integrity or culture.

The Head of Product Design will define and implement the overall design strategy for the core Titanbay products and will be responsible for its delivery alongside their team of UX/UI Designers to create exceptional products which will delight the Titanbay users

Requirements

  • A strong portfolio demonstrating excellent research skills, design skills, strategic thinking and the ability to solve complex design/business problems
  • 5+ years of experience preferably in designing user-facing applications within Finance, Wealth Management, Capital Markets, Private Equity, Trade, Investments and/or SaaS Enterprise application design
  • Strong people management skills with experience in managing high-performing teams and supporting their career growth with progression frameworks
  • The ability to think at a high level about product strategy and clearly articulate design decisions to all levels across the business and communicate business requirements back to the design team
  • Expert Figma skills
  • Experience evolving Design Systems
  • Prior experience working in agile sprints alongside development teams

 

You are:
  • A motivated Head of Product Design who is comfortable taking projects end to end from brief through research, information architecture, wireframes, visual design and handover to development.
  • A democratic “hands-on” leader who is as comfortable contributing to the day-to-day design work as you are implementing the bigger picture strategy and managing design teams
  • A strategic thinker who can drive the creative vision
  • An inspiring leader with the ability to build and nurture high-quality design teams
  • Passionate about making complex systems simple and easy to use
  • Comfortable liaising with and presenting to business stakeholders with strong communication skills
  • Well-versed at working with multidisciplinary teams working arm in arm with Product and Development
  • A design advocate who is excited about helping the business develop its design maturity and can positively influence design culture within Titabay

Benefits

We're a growing start-up, and we are building for the future - part of our 2022 remit will be to expand our benefits programme.

 

Current benefits:

  • 28 days annual leave plus bank holidays
  • Private health insurance
  • 8% pension access via NEST on completion of probation
  • Wellness offerings
  • Annual company offsite
  • Gym access in London
  • Flexible working

 

Titanbay does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, colour, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.

results.title: Director of UX Research & Design
results.description:
At ReturnLogic, exceptional user experiences are essential to our product and what our customers need from our platform. We are looking for an equally exceptional leader who will help shape the user experience research and design to fuel our next stage of growth.

You have at least 10 years of experience as a practicing designer, with at least 5 years building and managing design teams. You pride yourself in your ability to identify and nurture talent, while creating an environment for everyone to do their best work.

What You’ll Do:

We are looking for a Director of UX Research & Design to grow and lead a talented team of UX designers. You will work with cross-functional leaders across product management, engineering, product marketing, and customer success teams to ensure that the customer remains central to how we build our product. You will be a part of our Product & Engineering organization’s senior leadership team, conveying the impact of user experience to the larger organization, and shaping how the product organization innovates in a high-growth environment. You will initiate, drive, and measure positive change in product research and design practices that serve internal and cross-functional needs.

This role will have 4 primary responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with product development partners and stakeholders to achieve business goals predictably and sustainably
  • Lead and grow a team of UX designers meeting the needs of the product department
  • Create the organizational structure, define the roles, and establish the philosophy/mindset for how the team approaches its work
  • Drive innovative efforts that uncover new value with new experiences

Requirements

  • 10+ years of experience designing digital products and services
  • 5+ years building and managing design teams in a high-growth environment
  • Clear, concise, and cogent communication skills
  • Experience coaching and managing people managers and leaders
  • Experience working at a high-growth SaaS company – particularly Enterprise SaaS, and particularly B2B2C
  • Experience leading cross-functional teams in solving defined and undefined problem spaces
  • Solid understanding of practical UX research methods (qualitative and quantitative)
  • Successful usage, adoption, and/or implementation of a design system within complex software
  • Clear understanding of web application best practices
  • Broad and deep subject matter expertise in software product research and design
  • Ability to establish, circulate and maintain user personas and end-to-end user experiences
  • Extensive experience leading and growing a diverse and distributed team of UX designers in a start-up environment
  • Extensive knowledge of product research and design tools, practices, processes, and models
  • Demonstrable success in driving product research and design vision, strategy, and execution at the product level
  • Be empathetic, creative, confident, assertive, and analytical

Benefits

  • Half Day Fridays (through end of 2022)
  • Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
  • Retirement Plan (401k with match)
  • Life Insurance
  • Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
  • Paid Family Leave (birthing and non-birthing parents)
  • Short-Term & Long-Term Disability
  • Training & Development
  • Work From Home

Salary Range:

  • $130,000 to $160,000

About Us:

We are a company led by start-up people that like solving problems and building things. The leadership team is transparent and engages every employee in the strategy, objectives, targets — and results.

At ReturnLogic we value the unique backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives each team member brings to our workplace every day. We believe everyone deserves a fair shot at success and appreciate the experiences each person brings beyond the traditional job requirements. If you are a close but not exactly match with the description, we hope you will still consider applying.
